title: SCF UI Options Page(s)
description: Schema for Secure Custom Fields UI Options Page definitions - accepts single object or array. Properties marked '[SCF Export Only]' are preserved during export but not used functionally during import.

oneOf.description: Array of UI Options Page objects (export format)

key.description: Unique identifier for the options page with ui_options_page_ prefix (e.g. 'ui_options_page_site_settings')

title.description: The title/name of the options page

menu_slug.description: The menu slug used in the admin URL (e.g. 'site-settings'). Lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, and dashes only.

page_title.description: The page title displayed in the browser tab and page heading

parent_slug.description: The parent menu slug. Use 'none' for top-level menu, or a WordPress admin menu slug (e.g. 'options-general.php') for submenu.

menu_title.description: The title displayed in the admin menu

active.description: [SCF] Whether this options page is active

advanced_configuration.description: [SCF Export Only] Whether advanced configuration options are enabled. Accepts boolean or integer (0/1).

import_source.description: [SCF Export Only] Source of import if this options page was imported

import_date.description: [SCF Export Only] Date when this options page was imported

modified.description: [SCF Export Only] Unix timestamp of last modification

menu_order.description: [SCF Export Only] The order of this options page in the admin menu

icon_url.description: [Legacy] Icon URL or dashicon class. Prefer menu_icon object format for new configurations.

oneOf.description: Icon as string: Dashicon name (e.g. 'dashicons-admin-generic') or full URL to image file

type.description: Icon source type: 'dashicons' for WordPress dashicons, 'url' for custom image URL, 'media_library' for media library attachment

value.description: The icon value: dashicon class name, image URL, or media library attachment ID

menu_icon.description: The menu icon. Can be a string (URL or dashicon name) or SCF object format with type and value properties.

position.description: The position in the menu where this page should appear. SCF exports as empty string or null when not set, integer when set.

redirect.description: When child pages exist for this parent page, whether to redirect to the first child page

description.description: A descriptive summary of the options page

update_button.description: The label used for the submit button which updates the fields on the options page

updated_message.description: The message displayed after successfully updating the options page

capability.description: The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user

data_storage.description: Where to store field data. 'options' uses the options table, 'post_id' uses custom storage.

post_id.description: Custom storage location when data_storage is 'post_id'. Can be a numeric post ID (123) or a string ('user_2').

autoload.description: Whether to autoload the options when WordPress loads. Improves performance for frequently accessed options.
